Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from numerous fragments) of Milesian pottery ionian cup; interior black; exterior: lip glazed, handle zone reserved with band near top; lower body black with one reserved band. Two pairs of drill holes (repair holes).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1545, which has a reserved band near top of lip, (and is also repaired).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.840)
